PAsso 0.1.9

3-D P-P plot for the inspection of the partial association analysis

Source: R/plot3D.R
plot3D.Rd

A list of 3-D P-P plots for the inspection of the partial association analysis. Each plot is the 3-D P-P plot from an empirical copula trained from the surrogate residuals of a pair of responses.

plot3D(object, y1, y2, ...)

# S3 method for default
plot3D(object, y1, y2, ...)

# S3 method for PAsso
plot3D(object, y1, y2, ...)

Arguments

object

A PAsso class of object.
y1

A string to specify the first response for the 3D plot.
y2

A string to specify the second response for the 3D plot. If either one of the y1 or y2 is missing. The plot3D will draw 3D plots for all pairs of responses.
...

Additional optional arguments.

Value

If response y1 or y2 is not specified, a list of "plotly" objects includes all pairs of responses will be returned (with name "response 1 v.s. response 2" etc.). If responses y1 and y2 are specified, returns a 3D plot as "plotly" object.

Details

All the plots are based on surrogate residuals generated from "resides" function in sure. Graphics are designed based on PAsso and "plotly".

Examples

# Did not run this to save time
# data("ANES2016")
# PAsso_3v <- PAsso(responses = c("PreVote.num", "PID", "selfLR"),
#                   adjustments = c("income.num", "age", "edu.year"),
#                   data = ANES2016)

# plot3D(PAsso_3v, y1="PID", y2="selfLR")
